etymologies: late 18th century: from French, perhaps from obsolete Dutch loeris ‘clown’

definitions: a small, slow-moving nocturnal primate with a short or absent tail, living in dense vegetation in southern Asia.

notes.text: Genera Loris and Nycticebus, family Lorisidae, suborder Prosimii: the slender loris (L. tardigradus) of southern India and Sri Lanka, and the slow loris (genus Nycticebus, two species) of Southeast Asia

shortDefinitions: small, slow-moving nocturnal Asian primate with short or absent tail
